alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 8:04PM CDT until March 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama and southwest Alabama, including the following counties, in south central Alabama, Wilcox. In southwest Alabama, Clarke. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thomasville, Camden, Yellow Bluff, Pebble Hill, Rockwest, Dry Forks, Nellie, Coal Bluff, Coy, Sheppard, Shawnee, Estelle, Culpeper, Rosebud, Darlington, Hestle, Ackerville and Roundhill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
